result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamari Kenovontah Easley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Shamari Kenovontah Easley.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shamari Kenovontah Easley appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled and requested a DPA hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the bench warrant prior to its issuance due to defendant's appearance in court.   
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $35.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 11/1/2022 and on the first of each month until paid in full.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f
  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.  Court takes no action on bail at this time.
Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley not in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shamari Kenovontah Easley appeared by video means. Defendant has not obtained counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shamari Kenovontah Easley not in court.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@1:00PM
